name: Blockworks Daily
title: Utf8b8jfqg Investing In A New Thing Abundance
text:
Synopsis
The AI infrastructure market may be experiencing a potential bubble similar to the dotcom era, with the emergence of low-cost AI models like DeepSeek challenging existing market assumptions about GPU demand and tech company valuations.

Key Insights
- NVIDIA shares fell 17% after the release of DeepSeek, a low-cost Large Language Model (LLM) that can be trained using older GPU models at a significantly lower cost ($5.6 million vs. hundreds of millions spent by US companies)
- The market is questioning whether AI infrastructure companies can generate profits, drawing parallels to the dotcom bubble burst in 2001
- Open-source AI models like DeepSeek may disrupt the perceived value of mega-cap tech companies as AI gatekeepers
- Investors are now challenged to identify profitable AI use cases beyond infrastructure development
- Potential positive outcome: Cheap and plentiful AI infrastructure could enable new profitable use cases, similar to how the dotcom bust led to the rise of FANG companies
- Ben Thompson predicts that model commoditization and cheaper AI inference could benefit big tech companies like Apple, Amazon, Meta, and Microsoft by potentially reducing their capital expenditure
